titleproper.value:
Guide to the Relyea Family Papers
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1839-1924 </date>(bulk 1860-1900)
                    <date></date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num></num>
                    <num>MS 518</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Gregory Tavormina

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-11-02T16:25-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The papers cover over three generations of the Relyea family, but particularly concern Peter Relyea. The collection includes letters, legal documents, accounts, and also contains documents relevant to the Rosevelt family.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as Relyea Family Papers, MS 518, The New-York Historical Society.

Relyea relocated to Williamsburg, Brooklyn in 1869, and was appointed an Official Undertaker of that city in 1881. Peter Relyea married Elizabeth Ryers in 1838. After her death in 1866, he married C.A. Decker. A long-time Freemason, Peter Relyea was buried in Greenwood Cemetery in Brooklyn with Masonic honors.
The Relyea Papers do not include any information regarding Peter Relyea's construction of Abraham Lincoln's hearse.

subject.value: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) - Buildings, structures, etc.
Funeral rites and ceremonies - New York (State) - New York

Undertakers and undertaking - New York (State) - New York
Williamsburg (New York, N.Y.) - Buildings, structures, etc. - Design and construction.
